purpleculture_examples:
黃河 [ huáng hé ]: Yellow River or Huang He
黃金 [ huáng jīn ]: gold; golden (opportunity); prime (time)
黃色 [ huáng sè ]: yellow (color); pornographic
黃昏 [ huáng hūn ]: dusk; evening; nightfall
黃土 [ huáng tǔ ]: loess (yellow sandy soil typical of north China)

heisig_chinese_memo: The salad did not look very appetizing... The sprouts were yellow and there were animal legs sticking out of it.

huáng: (прил) желтый
huáng: (прил) порнографический
huáng: (ключ) желтый
huáng: (сущ/глаг) продукт животного происхождения желтого цвета; (сокр.) Хуанхэ; (разг.) проваливаться, терпеть неудачу
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The salad did not look very appetizing... The sprouts were yellow and there were animal legs sticking out of it.
origin_of_ch_char_book: The king wearing the crown also treasured jade, which was considered even more valuable than gold in East Asia. (黃, 黄, huang, yellow) depicts a man of high position (大, da, big) standing proudly and wearing a decoration around his waist . In those times, the man in high positions wore a waist decoration carved in jade.,(泉, quan=ch’üan, spring) suggests water from a spring and flowing downwards through the waterway. It depicts springwater gushing from the depths. The ancient Chinese thought of life as being like a flowing stream, coming from somewhere and going somewhere unknown. Therefore, they called the place where dead people go a “yellow spring (黃泉)”, or “netherworld”. They believed that when one died, one would go to underworld beneath the spring.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The elephant man faces up to the sky and his abdomen is swollen, indicating a handicapped person (Tang Lan, Qiu Xigui) with a swollen breast and belly. Later used as the color yellow. The ancients had the custom of burning patients in desperate periods of drought, hoping for rain, "Zuo Zhuan. "21 Years in Xi": "Summer, severe drought, public desires to burn witches." Du's note: "Or think that 尪 is not a witch. It entered the nose, so it was drought, and it was burned by public desire." Later, the habit of exposing patients to the sun evolved, "Book of Rites. "Under the Tan Gong" refers to "It won't rain for a long time, I want to be violent and ridicule."

" Huang " is the original word for "尪", "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. "Ming Li" Gao You's Note: "Gao, short-seekers are also." "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. "Finally" Gao Luu's note: "尪, protruding chest (upward) to the disease." All show that "尪" is a patient with a bulging chest and abdomen and a short stature. The original meaning of " yellow " is not only a patient but also a disease. In the handed down literature, there is still a saying that " huang " means " disease ", such as "Er Ya. Gu release ":" Huang, also sick, "according to the term" yellow disease, "said the text found in early," said the text ":" jaundice, yellowing disease also "" yellow "means a person or belly snake, thus bulging belly.

Oracle " Huang bloating of the" Elephant Man character shape, old misinterpretation as " pay ", see the " cross ." Later, the oracle bone inscriptions might add a pen on the abdomen, and the bronze inscriptions were also written in this way, and the word " kou " was added to the character to express the meaning of looking up to the sky (Ji Xusheng).

One of the most common Oracle inscriptions is "Huang Yin". He was an old minister in the Shang Dynasty. Suspected is "Yi Yin". "Compilation" 916 states: "㞢 (Yor) Yu Huang Yin Shi Fa, Shi Niu." means ten human sacrifices. , Ten cows came to make a sacrifice to Yi Yin. "book. "Jun Xi": "When you become a soup, you will be ordered, and when you are in a soup, there will be Ruoyiyin." Also used as the color " yellow ", "Collection" 11167: "Scalper." "Escape": "Hold on to the leather of the scalper, and Mo will win off."

The inscription " yellow " refers to yellow, and Zeng Baiyan: "Yu Zeqiji Golden Furnace", that is, I choose solid bronze and yellow metal. " Yellow " also refers to the belt used by people to tie jade ornaments, and the handed down classics are often written as " heng ". Mao Gongding: "Zhu Shi (韍), Chu Huang", chanting: "Yi (Gi) Girl (Ru) Xuan Yi, Yu Tun (Pure), Chishi (Yun), Zhu Huang". "Book of Rites. Tamamo ":" Three life kneepad red onion balance, "Zheng Xuan Note:" Heng, Heng Pei-yu's also "Mr.Tanglan considered" yellow "with jade ornaments of referring to the Department, the division 𩛥 Ding" Zhu Huang, "the" yellow "plus From the " market ", it can be proved that " yellow " is related to silk fabrics. Also used as the name of a person or country.

The " yellow " of the bamboo slips of the Warring States period refers to the color, "Shangbo Bamboo Book III. Jian 37 of the Book of Changes: "Hunting the crystal (three) fox, get the yellow arrow, Zhenji" means that when hunting in the field, you can get three foxes, you can get the yellow arrow, and Zhenwen is lucky. Also used as a place name, such as "Tsinghua Jian two. "Lian Nian" Jian 110: "The princes of the Jinjian Guild, who met the husband and Qin (chai) king in Huangchi."

" Yellow " originally refers to disease, but later interpreted as " yellow " as a color, which is considered purely a fake. Liang Donghan thinks that people with yellow disease have more sallow skin, "Historical Records. The Biography of Bian Que Cang mentions that the symptoms of yellow disease include "large abdomen and yellow and thick upper skin." Therefore, " yellow " has the original meaning of yellow, so let me talk about it.

"Shuowen": "Yellow, the color of the earth. From the field to the crust, the crust also sounds. The crust, the ancient text is light. All the yellow belongs to the yellow." According to Xu Shen, it is not the original meaning of the word " yellow ".
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: An oracle-bone like a handicapped person with a big belly and a thick short. Later used as the color yellow.
humanum_full_description:
象人仰面向天，腹部脹大，表示胸肚隆起、身材粗短的殘廢人(唐蘭、裘錫圭)。後用作顏色之黃。古人在大旱不雨時，有焚燒病人，冀求上天降雨的風俗，《左傳．僖二十一年》：「夏，大旱，公欲焚巫尪。」杜預注：「或以為尪非巫也，瘠病之人，其面上向，俗謂天哀其病，恐雨入其鼻，故為之旱，是以公欲焚之。」後又演變有曝曬病人的習慣，《禮記．檀弓下》即提到「天久不雨，吾欲暴尪而奚若。」

　　「黃」是「尪」的本字，《呂氏春秋．明理》高誘注：「尪，短仰者也。」《呂氏春秋．盡數》高誘注：「尪，突胸卬(仰)向疾也。」皆說明「尪」是胸腹隆起、身材粗短的病人。「黃」本義既為病人，亦可指疾病。傳世文獻中仍有訓「黃」為「病」，如《爾雅．釋詁》：「黃，病也。」按「黃病」一詞早見於說文，《說文》：「疸，黃病也。」「黃」或指人肚中長蟲，因而肚子鼓脹。

　　甲骨文「黃」字象人腹脹之形，舊誤釋為「交」，參見「交」。後來甲骨文或於腹上加飾筆，金文亦作這種寫法，另於字上加從「口」，以表示其仰天呼嘆之意(季旭昇)。

　　甲骨文多見「黃尹」一名，為商代舊臣，疑即「伊尹」，《合集》916正：「㞢(侑)于黃尹十伐、十牛。」意指用十個人牲、十隻牛來對伊尹進行侑祭。《書．君奭》：「成湯即受命，時則有若伊尹。」又用作顏色之「黃」，《合集》11167：「黃牛。」《易．遯》：「執之用黃牛之革，莫之勝脫。」

　　金文「黃」指黃色，曾白簠：「余擇其吉金黃鑪」，即我選擇堅固的青銅和黃色的金屬。「黃」又指人用以繫玉飾之帶，傳世典籍多寫作「衡」。毛公鼎：「朱巿(韍)、悤黃」，頌鼎：「易(賜)女(汝)玄衣、黹屯(純)、赤巿(韍)、朱黃」。《禮記．玉藻》：「三命赤韍蔥衡」，鄭玄注：「衡，佩玉之衡也。」唐蘭認為「黃」即指繫玉飾之帶，師𩛥鼎「朱黃」之「黃」加從「巿」，說明「黃」與絲織物有關，可證其說。又用作人名或國名。

　　戰國竹簡「黃」指顏色，《上博竹書三．周易》簡37：「畋獵晶(三)狐，得黃矢，貞吉」，意指田獵時能獲得三隻狐狸，能得到黃色的箭矢，貞問得吉兆。又用作地名，如《清華簡二．繫年》簡110：「晉簡公會諸侯，以與夫秦(差)王相見于黃池。」

　　「黃」本指疾病，後來解作顏色之「黃」，有以為純屬假借。梁東漢則認為患黃病者多皮膚蠟黃，《史記．扁鵲倉公列傳》提到黃病的徵狀包括「腹大，上膚黃粗」，所以「黃」才由本義引申有黃色的意思，姑備一說。

　　《說文》：「黃，地之色也。从田从炗，炗亦聲。炗，古文光。凡黃之屬皆从黃。」按許慎所述並非「黃」字本義。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文象大肚子、粗矮的殘廢人。後用作顏色之黃。

English Definition: yellow; pornographic; to fall through

Pictographic: A jade pendant

Example Words:
黃河 [ huáng hé ]: Yellow River or Huang He
黃金 [ huáng jīn ]: gold; golden (opportunity); prime (time)
黃色 [ huáng sè ]: yellow (color); pornographic
黃昏 [ huáng hūn ]: dusk; evening; nightfall
黃土 [ huáng tǔ ]: loess (yellow sandy soil typical of north China)

Simplified in your browser 简体字的浏览器显示:黄

Simplified in Unicode standard 简体字的Unicode标准:U+9EC4

Main pronunciation 主要发音: 黄

Other pronunciations 其它发音: Not exists.

Original meaning 本义: Meaning yellow.

English senses 英语理解: yellow; surname

Usage example 用法举例: 黃金 huáng jīn (gold)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 445

Shuowen 说文解字: 地之色也從田從炗炗亦聲炗古文光凡黃之屬皆從黃

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Component 黃 from person-big 大 dà and sun-day 日 rì and (rem+ 廿 niàn jade-huang 璜) and (not- 艹) simp 黄. (name- yellow-sun (黄)黃 huáng)

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
(- modern versions have a huang 廿璜 huáng around the neck) (- 黃道 - the path of the sun, ecliptic) (- oracle is combination of 大 and 日 or 大 and 口 or Big Sun) (- 太陽道 also means the path of the big light)

Pictographic: A jade pendant
  • ⿱ Above to below

    • ⿱ Above to below
      • ⿱ Above to below
        • 一 [ yī ] one; a, an; alone
        • 由 [ yóu ] cause, reason; from

①像金子或向日葵花的顏色：黃色。黃昏。牛黃。黃澄澄。信口雌黃。
②特指中國黃河：黃災。治黃。黃泛區。
③指“黃帝”(即“軒轅氏”，傳說中原始社會部落聯盟首領)：黃老(黃帝和老子)。炎黃子孫。
④事情失敗或計劃不能實現：事情黃了。
⑤姓氏。

The crust, the ancient text is light. All the yellow belongs to the yellow." According to Xu Shen, it is not the original meaning of the word " yellow".

黃字的康熙字典解释

【亥集下】【黃字部】　黃； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1516第03
〔古文〕?【唐韻】乎光切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】胡光切，?音皇。【說文】地之色也。【玉篇】中央色也。【易·坤卦】黃裳元吉。象曰：黃裳元吉，文在中也。【文言】君子黃中通理。　又【史記·天官書】日月五星所行之道曰黃道。　又山名。【前漢·東方朔傳】北至池陽，西至黃山。　又黃河。【爾雅·釋水】河出崑崙虛，色白，所渠幷千七百，一川色黃。　又地名。【春秋·哀十四年】公會晉侯及吳子于黃池。【註】陳留封丘縣南有黃亭。　又國名。【左傳·桓八年】楚子合諸侯于沈鹿，黃隨不會。【註】黃國，今弋陽縣。　又州名。古邾國，漢西陵縣，隋黃州。　又縣名。【前漢·地理志】黃縣屬東萊郡，內黃屬魏郡，外黃屬?留郡。【註】縣有黃溝澤，故名。師古曰：惠公敗宋師于黃，杜預以爲外黃縣東有黃城，卽此地。　又中黃，天子內藏。【後漢·桓帝紀】建和元年，芝生於黃藏府。　又官名。【杜氏通典】乗黃令，晉官，主乗輿金根車。【又】晉以后，給事黃門侍郞，散騎常侍，俱屬門下省，稱曰黃散。　又老人曰黃髮。【禮·曲
